page.title: 19MR.FRED CHANCELLOR, WORDSLEY
page.content: On the 13th April,1985 we visited {Mr.Chancellor}of Barnett Lane who is 99 years old (he will be 100 in February) and is a retired train driver. He was born in Oldbury and was taken to Halesowen the same day. He attended the Church School and Halesowen Grammar School. His three brothers and one sister are all dead. From his childhood he wanted to be an engine driver but his chance of success was around a hundred to one.He moved to{Wordsley}and at 17 years old he started at Stourbridge engine sheds He became a fireman and then a driver. He was exempt fron war service but saw plenty of bombing. His favourite route was the G.W.R. line from Birmingham (Snow Hill) to London (Paddington) where he holds the record for the fastest locomotive at 102 mph. He retired when sixty.{FAIRHAVEN PRIMARY.
